content: Maybe I'm writing wrong here, but I assume that on this board are new and old people can gather, maybe in gambling only a handful of people, I realize that gambling threads are one of the requirements for gambling signature campaign participants, at least 5 posts per week must be fulfilled, it's like a requirement to be completed, so that weekly missions are worth paying for, more easily new people may not be there yet on gambling board.Maybe the user rank up here are accepted on siganture campaign (judging by the signature used), I congratulate you, because it is not easy to make such gambling posts with many visitors and in quality assessments.I've been asking myself for a long time, even though I made a reply in the thread but there are obstacles that I want to ask. Look sir, I don't see pined in gambling discussions, the question is whether the rules are the same as how to create quality links on other boards? including how to write, sources, and how to get the information must be attached? or how do you think about matches? Or is prediction carelessly? there are rarely any sources on any prediction. Please don't misunderstand sir, I just want to learn from quality sports commentators like you and write about it, because the game will continue to be held in all cities and countries in all circles, also in this forum the contribution of signature campaign games is often held, enlivened with signature mixers, signature memes and other siganture. Because these are the facilities and advantages of the forum as a source of income for users in the bitcointalk forum in general and each person has the right to apply.There is nothing wrong with learning to be active on all boards early on for anyone, right sir,? to participate in future campaign needs for those who are eligible.Your answer will hopefully motivate all ranks on this forum including the new ones.

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: Writing rules are the same everywhere, if you wants to copy paste something then add quote tags and provide a source link otherwise you might be banned, a recent case indicates that. And just to clarify I don't make any posts in gambling discussions because I don't gamble but most of the discussions in Gambling are not always related to gambling but about sports too like Cricket which I love to discuss but I still don't make any post there and contribute in cricket discussion also (due to some reason I don't want to disclose).But I have to say, the posting rules, ethics, and norms are the same everywhere, if you wanted to reply under some thread then it should be a good one like not pasting, or rephrasing, or it would be good to remove grammatical mistakes from it.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: The most important step in making quality posts in any board is to have an interest in the topic of the board. Do not join gambling related campaigns if you do not have an interest in the gambling board, same goes for any other board, always align with posts that comes naturally to you.There is no sticky for the gambling discussion board, but here's a detailed description of what to do;"Discussion of sports games and other gambling-related topics which are separate from games and services themselves."Combine this and general posting etiquette and you'll be good.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Look OP, it seems like you're not really getting what this is all about.  The way you're looking at it is off-base.  You gotta take some time to actually understand how things work here before jumping to conclusions.  If you wanna be a part of what we've got going on - the forum, the campaigns, all of it - you should probably focus more on learning the basics first instead of making assumptions out of thin air. I mean why make such a fuss out of this? Its not that complicated.  There's no secret formula, but common sense plays a big role.  You want in on a signature campaign, you just follow the rules, don't spam, an d make relevant and informative posts.  As for writing in the gambling section, it's the same – provide valuable input and follow the board's guidelines.  No reason to overthink it and go on some huge rant over nothing.
